intro: Adike, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and prefers bright, indirect light. Adike is popular as a houseplant due to its ease of care and vibrant blossoms. Its botanical name is Saintpaulia, and it is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes.
